project_type: Real-time terminal-style chat app with Node.js backend and vanilla HTML/CSS/JS frontend
build_system: npm - no build step, just npm install and npm start
test_framework: No test framework configured; no existing tests
test_command: npm start (manual verification - no automated tests)
verification_instructions: 1. Run `cd /projects/sandbox/terminal-chat-server && npm install` 2. Run `npm start` in background 3. Verify server starts on port 3000 4. Check that the /gif command and GIF rendering code is present in public/index.html and server.js
environment_constraints: No external API keys available. Use a free, no-auth GIF API or embed GIF search via public APIs. No Docker daemon. No browser for manual UI testing - verify via server startup and code inspection.
contribution_requirements: Follow README: npm install, npm start. Files: server.js (backend), public/index.html (frontend, single-file with inline CSS/JS)

key_patterns.server_file_uploads: multer handles uploads in server.js with disk storage to /uploads. Separate upload endpoints per media type (/upload for images, /upload-voice for audio, /upload-video for video). File types validated by MIME type.
key_patterns.frontend_message_rendering: addMessage() function in public/index.html builds DOM elements. Images use toggle pattern: clickable '[Show Image]' span that reveals hidden with .expanded class. Same pattern for voice/video.
key_patterns.chat_commands: handleMessage() in public/index.html processes /commands (e.g., /nick, /color, /help, /clear). Commands are client-side processed.
key_patterns.socket_message_schema: Messages sent via socket.emit('send-message', { roomId, user, text, type, color, image, voice, video }). Server stores and broadcasts with these fields.
key_patterns.attachment_menu: Attach button (ðŸ“Ž) shows a dropdown menu with options for camera, gallery, video, voice. Each option triggers a hidden file input or recording flow.
key_patterns.css_styling: Terminal green-on-black theme. All CSS is inline in <style> tag in index.html. Image styling uses .chat-image class with max-width/max-height constraints.

relevant_files: server.js - Backend: Express routes, multer upload config, Socket.io message handling
public/index.html - Frontend: All HTML, CSS, and JS in a single file. ~1423 lines.
directory_structure: / - project root with server.js, package.json, package-lock.json, README.md, .gitignore; /public/ - static frontend with index.html; /uploads/ - runtime directory for uploaded files (gitignored)
